column2: Letters}}, Note, ''The names of the letters''</ref><ref group=note>The term ''óre'', despite being translated as "heart", does not have the same meaning as in English: it does not correspond to the physical organ, memory, reflection, emotion, feelings or positive impulses. The ''óre'' is a conscience or instinct that advises or warns the [[Incarnate
column3: Incarnates]] to proper courses  of action. (Cf. {{VT

column2: Notes on Óre]]", ''óre'' ("heart (inner mind)") derives from the [[Common Eldarin]] [[Sundocarme
column3: root]] [[ƷOR]]. The word is also said to be associated with the root [[OR]], although probably not "semantically connected".<ref name="VT41:11"/>

column2: ''Etymologies'']], the word ''óre'' ("rising") derives from root [[OR#Other versions

left]]''Óre'' is also the name in Quenya of the twenty-first letter of the [[Tengwar]] alphabet.<ref name="Names"/>  It is the first letter of the sixth grade or [[Tyellë]], which contains "semi-vocalic" consonants and it is the sixth letter in the dental or ''t''-series of consonants, the ''[[Tincotéma]]''.  In most modes this letter represents weak or untrilled '''R''' (usually used medially or at the end of words).<ref>{{App
column3: Letters}}</ref>  However, in the [[Mode of Beleriand]], as in the inscription on the [[Doors of Durin
column5: Letters}}, footnote 2</ref>  The Westron name for this letter is '''''Ar'''''.<ref>See [[Westron Tengwar]]</ref>
